page.title: 16RECREATION.SHOOTING.
page.content: We asked Mr Hugill of Ellermire View about shooting in the dale and this is what he said. The number of people in his syndicate is 8 and their total bag for 1984-85 was duck 18 partridge 16 English partridge 13 French. snipe 6 pheasant 124. pigeons 6 hares 26. woodcock 20. rabbits 50. The average cost of shooting a pheasant is Â£12.00. The average cost of a gun is Â£200. The cost gun certificates is Â£50. The whole season lasts from August 12th-February 1st. Young are often bred at home and released at 12 weeks.Bantams make the best foster mothers and any extra poults are bought from the game farm.
